com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.filesystem

Class DirectoryListing

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.googlecode.kevinarpe.papaya.filesystem.DirectoryListing

  • @FullyTested
public final class DirectoryListing
extends Object
    Replaces File.listFiles(). Provides ability to filter and sort the listing, similar to the UNIX command line tool /bin/ls.

    Numerous Comparators for class File are included in this library, including:

    • FileAbsolutePathLexicographicalComparator
    • FileLastModifiedOldestToNewestComparator
    • FileNameLexicographicalComparator
    • FileNameNumericPrefixSmallestToLargestComparator
    • FileSizeSmallestToLargestComparator
    • FileTypeComparator
    Author:
    Kevin Connor ARPE (kevinarpe@gmail.com)

    • Constructor Detail

      • DirectoryListing

        public DirectoryListing(File dirPath)
                 throws PathException
        This is a convenience constructor for DirectoryListing(File, Class) where listClass is DEFAULT_LIST_CLASS.
        Throws:
        PathException

      • DirectoryListing

        public DirectoryListing(File dirPath,
                Class<? extends List> listClass)
                 throws PathException
        Builds a list of child paths for a directory. Access the list of child paths via getChildPathList().
        Parameters:
        dirPath - path to directory used to obtain a listing of child paths
        listClass - controls the List class used internally. If filtering a large list of paths, it will be more efficient to use LinkedList.class.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if path or listClass is null
        PathException -
        • with reason PathExceptionReason.PATH_DOES_NOT_EXIST if path does not exist
        • with reason PathExceptionReason.PATH_IS_NORMAL_FILE if path exists, but is not a directory
        • with reason PathExceptionReason.PATH_IS_NON_EXECUTABLE_DIRECTORY if path exists as a directory, but is not accessible for listing
        • with reason PathExceptionReason.UNKNOWN if reason for error is unknown
        IllegalArgumentException - if calling method Class.newInstance() fails for listClass
        See Also:
        DirectoryListing(File), DEFAULT_LIST_CLASS, getDirPath(), getChildPathList()

      • DirectoryListing

        public DirectoryListing(DirectoryListing other)
        This is a convenience constructor for DirectoryListing(DirectoryListing, Class) where listClass is getChildPathList().getClass().

      • DirectoryListing

        public DirectoryListing(DirectoryListing other,
                Class<? extends List> listClass)
        Copies another instance of this class including the List class used internally to store child paths.
        Parameters:
        other - another instance of this class
        listClass - controls the List class used internally. If filtering a large list of paths, it will be more efficient to use LinkedList.class.
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if other or listClass is null
        IllegalArgumentException - if calling method Class.newInstance() fails for listClass

    • Method Detail

      • getDirPath

        public File getDirPath()
        Returns:
        parent directory for child paths
        See Also:
        getChildPathList()

      • getChildPathList

        public List<File> getChildPathList()
        Returns:
        reference to the internal list of child paths. This is not a copy, so changes made to the list will affect the internal state of this instance.

      • sort

        public DirectoryListing sort(Comparator<File> fileComparator)
        Performs an in-place sort on the list of child paths using a Comparator. This method operates directly on the internal list. To preserve the current instance, use the copy constructor first, then sort.

        To combine more than one comparator, consider using ComparatorUtils.chain(Collection).

        Parameters:
        fileComparator - how to sort paths. Must not be null. See class docs for a information about file comparators included in this library.
        Returns:
        reference to this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if fileComparator is null
        See Also:
        DirectoryListing(DirectoryListing), DirectoryListing(DirectoryListing, Class), filter(FileFilter)

      • filter

        public DirectoryListing filter(FileFilter fileFilter)
        Applies a filter to remove paths from the to the internal list of child paths. This method operates directly on the internal list. To preserve the current instance, use a copy constructor first, then sort.

        To combine more than one file filter, consider using FileFilterUtils.anyOf(Collection) or FileFilterUtils.allOf(Collection).

        As an optimisation, this method uses different strategies for list element removal depending upon if the List class used for internal storage implements interface RandomAccess. For example, list class ArrayList implements interface RandomAccess, but list class LinkedList does not.

        Parameters:
        fileFilter - how to filter paths. Must not be null.
        Returns:
        reference to this
        Throws:
        NullPointerException - if fileFilter is null
        See Also:
        DirectoryListing(DirectoryListing), DirectoryListing(DirectoryListing, Class), sort(Comparator)

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns hash code of getDirPath(), getChildPathList(), and the List class used. This will differentiate between two instances of this class using a different internal storage List class.
        Overrides:
